sentence: Seven Republicans have entered the primary race to oust Cawthorn, with two sources telling the Washington Examiner that state Sen. Chuck Edwards and businesswoman Michele Woodhouse could be viable contenders.
author: Juliegrace Brufke
title: Republicans turn against Rep. Madison Cawthorn after orgies and cocaine comment

sentence: North Carolina Republican Sen. Thom Tillis made the rare move of publicly endorsing Cawthorn's primary opponent, state Sen. Chuck Edwards, saying in a statement that Cawthorn has "fallen well short of the most basic standards Western North Carolina expects from their representatives."
author: Andrew Kerr
title: Madison Cawthorn spent taxpayer funds at luxury resort

sentence: The controversies have sparked a competitive primary to oust him in North Carolina, and Tillis has endorsed state Sen. Chuck Edwards (R) in the race.
author: Tal Axelrod
title: Tillis calls for investigation of Cawthorn over insider trading allegations

sentence: Tillis has endorsed one of Cawthorn's primary opponents, state Senator Chuck Edwards, and a super PAC connected to Tillis has spent $300,000 on an ad campaign that accused Cawthorn of "lying about conservatives" and dubbed him an "attention-seeking embarrassment."
author: Darragh Roche
title: Madison Cawthorn Is Under Attack from the Right
